Key Match Events: San Diego Padres won 10-2 in NL Division Series Game 2 against the Los Angeles Dodgers.
Jurickson Profar robbed Mookie Betts of a home run in the first inning.
Jack Flaherty hit Fernando Tatis Jr. with a pitch, leading to an exchange of words between Flaherty and Manny Machado.
Jack Flaherty struck out Manny Machado with Tatis and another runner on in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt condemned the fan behavior, stating it was unacceptable.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts described the incident as ugly and unprecedented in his experience.
Jurickson Profar expressed his frustration with the fans' behavior, emphasizing the potential danger.
Manny Machado urged his teammates to stay focused despite the distractions.
Umpire crew chief Dan Bellino emphasized the need for enhanced security to prevent further incidents.
Manny Machado reflected on the importance of not retaliating against star players like Shohei Ohtani.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was delayed for 12 minutes due to unruly fan behavior, including throwing baseballs and trash onto the field.
Dodgers security staff attempted to identify and remove the fans responsible for the disruptions.
Public address announcer Todd Leitz requested the crowd to refrain from throwing objects onto the field.
There was trash on the warning track in right field near the Padres bullpen, prompting additional security measures.
